comments:
Created an attachment (id=77706)
Check type error

Build ID: I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
Reproduce:
1. Create a bar chart and open chart builder dialog.
2. Switch to "Select Data" tab and set dataset, select category series and Y series columns. Make sure all value of category series are null.
3. Switch to "Format Chart" tab and select "X-axis" sheet, set type of X-axis to DateTime.

Expected result:
The category label in X-axis should display as "null" and chart can be preview.

Actual result:
The chart can't be preview and exception is thrown.

Exception:
org.eclipse.birt.chart.exception.ChartException: Unable to use a non-datetime data to render a datetime axis.

Caused by: org.eclipse.birt.chart.exception.ChartException: Unable to use a non-datetime data to render a datetime axis.
	at org.eclipse.birt.chart.computation.withaxes.PlotWithAxes.getTypedDataSet(PlotWithAxes.java:667)
	at org.eclipse.birt.chart.computation.withaxes.PlotWithAxes.getTypedDataSet(PlotWithAxes.java:634)
	at org.eclipse.birt.chart.computation.withaxes.PlotWith2DAxes.compute(PlotWith2DAxes.java:670)
	at org.eclipse.birt.chart.factory.Generator.build(Generator.java:1021)
	... 47 more

The issue is that chart will create a dummy dataset if all values of category series are null, since can't judge the type of null value, so the type of dummy dataset is still set to numeric no matter the axis type user set. In this case, it will cause the type conflict between dataset type and axis type when chart generate plot.

Please use attached report example to reproduce it.
Added a special dataset NullDataSet, to represent null data when all category or value data are null. Now no matter axis type is number, datetime or text, null data could be handled correctly.

traces.message: Unable to use a non-datetime data to render a datetime axis.

causedBy.message: Unable to use a non-datetime data to render a datetime axis.
